Qualifiers.scope: Defines how setbacks are measured in the presence of specific easements.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots with Creek easements or Public street easements.
exclusions: Most public utility easements do not affect setbacks.

Variables.name: lot_line_location
Variables.description: The surveyed boundary of the lot.

Variables.name: easement_edge_location
Variables.description: The boundary of the easement area.

Constants.name: Measurement Procedure
Constants.value: Setbacks must be measured from the edge of the easement.

Conditions.logic: IF (easement_type IS 'Creek easement' OR easement_type IS 'Public street easement') THEN setback_measurement_origin IS 'edge of the easement'
dependencies: This measurement is performed regardless of the lot line location.

Exceptions.description: Most public utility easements are exempt from this rule and do not affect setback calculations.
Exceptions.ambiguous_language_flag: The term 'most' is ambiguous and would require clarification for automated validation.

cross-references.description: Contains more information about creek easements.
Contains more information about public street easements.
External agency to contact for information regarding creek easements.

Qualifiers.scope: Defines how setbacks are measured in relation to sidewalks and lot lines.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to all lots where a sidewalk is present near the lot line.

Variables.name: sidewalk_location
Variables.description: The physical location of the sidewalk.

Variables.name: lot_line_location
Variables.description: The surveyed boundary of the lot.

Variables.name: public_right_of_way_width
Variables.description: The space between the sidewalk edge and the lot line. Can be 0' or more than 15'.
Variables.ambiguous_language_flag: The phrase 'several feet' is ambiguous. The note 'may be 0' or more than 15'' provides a range but requires verification.

Constants.name: Measurement Procedure
Constants.value: Setbacks must be measured from the lot line.

dependencies: This measurement is performed regardless of the sidewalk location.

Exceptions.description: If the lot line is in the middle of the street, then the setback is measured from the edge of the public street easement or right-of-way.

cross-references.description: Illustrates the common circumstance and the rule.
Contains more information about public street easements.
External entity to contact to determine the exact distance between the sidewalk edge and the lot line.

extracted_rules.rule_name: Setback Determination for Oddly Shaped Lots (Reference)

Qualifiers.scope: Provides references for determining appropriate site plans for non-standard lot shapes.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots where setbacks and required yards are not obvious due to shape.
inclusions: lot with more than four sides

Conditions.logic: IF lot_shape IS one of the applicable types, THEN refer to the specified figure on page 23 for the appropriate site plan.
Conditions.ambiguous_language_flag: The condition 'may not be obvious' is subjective.

children: lot with more than four sides -> Figure 17 F & G

cross-references.description: Primary reference for appropriate site plans for various lot shapes.

logical_dependencies.description: The rules for these lot shapes are not in this text but are located in the referenced figures.

extracted_rules.rule_name: Reduced Setbacks for Flag and Substandard Lots

Qualifiers.scope: Describes specific instances where setbacks have been reduced.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to smaller or oddly shaped lots, specifically flag lots and certain substandard corner lots.

Variables.name: lot_width
Variables.description: Width of a substandard corner lot.

Conditions.logic: IF lot_type IS 'flag lot', THEN the 'front setback' may be reduced.
dependencies: The specific reduction is illustrated in Figure 17 A.

Conditions.logic: IF lot_type IS 'substandard corner lot' AND lot_width IS '< 50 ft', THEN the 'street-side yard setback' may be reduced.
dependencies: The specific reduction is illustrated in Figure 17 C.

Exceptions.description: This entire rule describes an exception to standard setback requirements, allowing for reductions under specific conditions.

cross-references.description: Illustrates reduced front setback for a flag lot.
Illustrates reduced street-side yard setback for substandard corner lots < 50' wide.

logical_dependencies.description: The actual value of the reduced setback is not defined in the text and is dependent on the referenced figures.
